page.title: 02Kegworth Parish Church.
page.content: {St. Andrews,}the{parish church}of {Kegworth,}was built in two halves in the 9th. and 15th. centuries. It stands in a prominent position in the village centre. Inside is a fine{Royal {Coat of Arms}given in recognition of loyal support during the{Civil War.}A passage under the{church}leads to {London Road}and supposedly contains treasure. There are 6 stained glass windows in the{church,}one containing some ancient glass fragments.The {church}has a tall{spire}housing 8 bells the tallest some 2m in height. The high ceiling has dark wooden beams at the end of which are carvings.Where the beams cross are flowers picked out in gold.The{organ}has an oak casing, and there is also an{eagle lecturn}and a{clergy vestry}dating back to the 15th. century approached by a small door from the{chancel.
